[[Keith Morrison]] (stepfather) | partner = [[Lizzy Caplan]] (2006-2012) }} '''Matthew Langford Perry''' (born August 19, 1969) is a Canadian-American actor, comedian and playwright known for his role as [[Chandler Bing]] on the [[NBC]] television sitcom ''[[Friends]]''.{{cite web|url=http://movies.msn.com/celebrities/celebrity-awards-and-nominations/matthew-perry.1|title=Matthew Perry - Awards & Nominations|publisher=Movies.msn.com|accessdate=December 24, 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywood.com/celebrity/191213/Matthew_Perry_Credits|title=Matthew Perry Credits|publisher=Hollywood.com|accessdate=December 24, 2011}} Along with starring in the short-lived television series ''[[Studio 60 on the Sunset Strip]]'', Perry has appeared in a number of films, including ''[[Fools Rush In (1997 film)|Fools Rush In]]'' (1997), ''[[The Whole Nine Yards (film)|The Whole Nine Yards]]'' (2000), and ''[[17 Again (film)|17 Again]]'' (2009).{{cite web|url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/celebrity/matthew_perry|title=Matthew Perry|publisher=Rotten Tomatoes|accessdate=December 24, 2011}} In 2010, he expanded his résumé to include both video games and voiceover work when he voiced Benny in the video game ''[[Fallout: New Vegas]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.cinemablend.com/games/Fallout-New-Vegas-Voice-Cast-Includes-Matthew-Perry-Wayne-Newton-Zach-Levi-26250.html|title=Fallout: New Vegas Voice Cast Includes Matthew Perry, Wayne Newton, Zach Levi|publisher=Cinemablend.com|date=August 10, 2010|accessdate=December 24, 2011}} Perry was the co-creator, co-writer, executive producer, and star of the [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] sitcom ''[[Mr. Sunshine (2011 TV series)|Mr. Sunshine]]'', which ran from February to April 2011.{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2010/12/06/abcs-mr-sunshine-will-bump-cougar-town-temporarily-plus-premiere-dates-for-happy-endings-off-the-map/74516|title=ABC's 'Mr. Sunshine' Will Bump 'Cougar Town'; Plus Dates For 'Happy Endings' & 'Off The Map'|last=Gorman|first=Bill|date=December 6, 2010|work=TV by the Numbers|accessdate=March 4, 2011}} In August 2012, Perry began starring as Ryan King, a sportscaster, on the [[NBC]] sitcom ''[[Go On (TV series)|Go On]]''. The series was canceled on May 10, 2013.{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2013/05/10/go-on-canceled-by-nbc/182012|title='Go On' Canceled by NBC After One Season|last=Kondolojy|first=Amanda|work=TV by the Numbers|date=May 10, 2013|accessdate=May 10, 2013}} Perry co-developed and starred in the 2015 [[CBS]] sitcom ''[[The Odd Couple (2015 TV series)|The Odd Couple]]'' portraying Oscar Madison.{{cite web|url=http://www.smh.com.au/entertainment/tv-and-radio/friends-star-matthew-perry-set-for-odd-couple-reboot-20140226-33gx5.html|title=Friends star Matthew Perry set for Odd Couple reboot}} The series was renewed for a second season on May 11, 2015{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2015/05/11/the-good-wife-hawaii-five-o-person-of-interest-more-renewed-by-cbs/402326/|title='The Good Wife', 'Hawaii Five-0', 'Person of Interest' & Many More Renewed by CBS|last=Bibel|first=Sara|work=TV by the Numbers|date=May 11, 2015|accessdate=May 11, 2015}} and for a third season on May 16, 2016.{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2016/05/code-black-criminal-minds-beyond-borders-odd-couple-undercover-boss-renewed-cbs-1201757112|title='Code Black', 'Criminal Minds: Beyond Borders', 'The Odd Couple' & 'Undercover Boss' Renewed By CBS|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|work=Deadline Hollywood|accessdate=May 16, 2016}} ==Early life== Perry was born in [[Williamstown, Massachusetts]] on August 19, 1969.{{cite web|url=http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/matthew-perry/bio/165367|title=Matthew Perry|publisher=TVGuide.com|accessdate=August 11, 2015}} His mother, Suzanne Marie Morrison (''née'' Langford), is a Canadian journalist and former press secretary to Canadian Prime Minister [[Pierre Trudeau]]. His father, [[John Bennett Perry]] (born 1941), is an American actor and former model.{{cite web|url=http://www.filmreference.com/film/19/Matthew-Perry.html|title=Matthew Perry Biography|publisher=Filmreference.com|accessdate=September 26, 2010}}{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2002/08/18/arts/film-the-fame-he-craved-came-but-it-wasn-t-enough.html|title=The Fame He Craved Came, but It Wasn't Enough|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|first=Dana|last=Kennedy|date=August 18, 2002|accessdate=September 30, 2011|quote=Mr. Perry, whose parents divorced when he was a baby, was raised by his mother, Suzanne Morrison,}}{{cite web|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=2194&dat=19680923&id=lboyAAAAIBAJ&sjid=5ewFAAAAIBAJ&pg=4626,2377310|title=Mr. and Mrs. John Bennett Perry|work=[[Ottawa Citizen]]|location=Ottawa, Ontario, Canada|date=September 23, 1968|quote=The marriage of Suzanne Marie Langford...}} His parents divorced before his first birthday and his mother subsequently married broadcast journalist [[Keith Morrison]]. He was raised by his mother in [[Ottawa, Ontario]], and was enrolled at [[Rockcliffe Park Public School]] and [[Ashbury College]]. While growing up, he took a keen interest in lawn tennis and became a top-ranked junior player. == Career == [[File:Matthew Perry 1995.jpg|251x251px|thumb|Perry departing rehearsal for the [[47th Primetime Emmy Awards|1995 Emmy Awards]]]] When he was 15, Perry moved from Ottawa to Los Angeles to pursue acting and attended [[Buckley School (California)|The Buckley School]] in Sherman Oaks, graduating in 1987.{{cite news|last1=Imperiale|first1=Nancy|title=Matthew Perry Was Tennis Whiz|url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/1995-10-15/entertainment/9510090598_1_matthew-perry-noah-wyle-sliders|accessdate=January 10, 2017|work=The Orlando Sentinel|date=October 15, 1995}}{{cite news|last1=Summer|first1=Sydne|title=My Reunion with Matthew Perry|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/58519/my-reunion-with-matthew-perry|accessdate=January 10, 2017|work=E! Online|date=May 21, 2007}} He pursued improv comedy at the LA Connection in Sherman Oaks while still in high school.{{citation needed|date=March 2016}} He went on to play Chazz Russell in the TV series ''[[Second Chance (1987 TV series)|Second Chance]]''. After 13 episodes, ''Second Chance'' became ''[[Boys Will Be Boys (TV series)|Boys Will Be Boys]]'', with the plots refocused on the adventures of Chazz and his teenage friends. After the show's single season, Perry stayed in Los Angeles and made his screen debut in the 1988 film ''[[A Night in the Life of Jimmy Reardon]]''.{{cite web|url=https://movies.yahoo.com/movie/contributor/1800018621/bio|title=Matthew Perry|publisher=[[Yahoo! Movies]]|accessdate=December 24, 2011|archivedate=January 18, 2012|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120118125023/http://movies.yahoo.com/movie/contributor/1800018621/bio}} He made a 1989 guest appearance on the series ''[[Growing Pains]]'', in which he portrayed Carol Seaver's boyfriend who dies from injuries sustained in a drunk-driving accident. In the midst of his many continuing guest roles on TV, Perry was cast as a regular on the 1990 [[CBS]] sitcom ''[[Sydney (TV series)|Sydney]]'', playing the younger brother of [[Valerie Bertinelli]]'s title character. In 1991, he made a guest appearance on ''[[Beverly Hills, 90210]]'' as Roger Azarian. Perry landed his next TV starring role on the [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] sitcom ''[[Home Free (1993 TV series)|Home Free]]'', which aired only 11 episodes in the spring of 1993. By then, Perry was making his mark, and was instantly cast in a sitcom pilot titled ''LAX 2194''. The project was slow to take off so, as a back-up option, he attempted to secure an audition for the pilot ''Six of One'', later to be known as ''[[Friends]]'', by [[Marta Kauffman]] and [[David Crane (producer)|David Crane]], both of whom he had worked with on ''[[Dream On (TV series)|Dream On]]''. However, due to previous commitments to the pilot ''LAX 2194'', he was not initially considered for an audition. When he did eventually get a reading, he landed the part of [[Chandler Bing]]. [[File:Matthew Perry by David Shankbone (cropped).jpg|left|thumb|213x213px|Perry in 2007]] ''Friends'' was hugely successful, and Perry, along with his co-stars, gained wide recognition among television viewers. The program earned him an [[Emmy]] nomination{{cite web|url=http://www.emmys.com/celebrities/matthew-perry|title=Matthew Perry|work=Television Academy}} in 2002 for [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor - Comedy Series|Outstanding Lead Actor in a Comedy Series]], along with [[Matt LeBlanc]], but the two lost to [[Ray Romano]]. Perry appeared in films such as ''[[Fools Rush In (1997 film)|Fools Rush In]]'' (alongside father [[John Bennett Perry]] and [[Salma Hayek]]), ''[[Almost Heroes]]'', ''[[Three to Tango]]'', ''[[The Whole Nine Yards (film)|The Whole Nine Yards]]'' (alongside [[Bruce Willis]]) and its sequel ''[[The Whole Ten Yards]]'', and ''[[Serving Sara]]''. While known primarily for his comic roles, Perry has carved out a career in drama as well, particularly in his portrayal of Associate [[White House Counsel]] Joe Quincy in [[Aaron Sorkin]]'s ''[[The West Wing (TV series)|The West Wing]]''. His three appearances in that series (twice in the fourth season and once in the fifth) earned him two [[Emmy Award|Emmy]] nominations for Outstanding Guest Actor in a Drama Series in 2003 and 2004. Perry is referred to in the show prior to his guest appearance - Donna Moss seeks him out (off screen) in the episode "20 Hours in LA." He also appeared as attorney Todd Merrick in two episodes near the end of ''[[Ally McBeal]]'''s five-season run, including a 2-hour special intended to revive the legal comedy-drama. After ''[[Friends]]'' wrapped up, Perry made his directorial debut in an episode of the 4th season of the American comedy-drama ''[[Scrubs (TV series)|Scrubs]]'', in which he also guest starred as "Murray Marks", an operator of a small airport's traffic control team. Murray is asked to donate a kidney to his father Gregory (played by Perry's real father). [[File:Matthew Perry 2010.jpg|thumb|304x304px|Perry in 2010]] He starred in the [[TNT (U.S. TV network)|TNT]] movie, ''[[The Ron Clark Story]]'' which premiered August 13, 2006. Perry played small-town teacher [[Ron Clark (teacher)|Ron Clark]] who relocates to the toughest class in the country. Perry received a [[Golden Globe]] nomination as well as an [[Emmy]] nomination for his performance.{{citation needed|date=July 2017}} In 2006-2007, Perry appeared in [[Aaron Sorkin]]'s drama ''[[Studio 60 on the Sunset Strip]]''. Perry played Matt Albie alongside [[Bradley Whitford]]'s Danny Tripp, a writer-director duo brought in to help save a failing [[Sketch comedy|sketch show]]. Perry's character was considered to be substantially based on Sorkin's own personal experiences, particularly in television.{{cite news|author=|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117936967?categoryid=14&cs=1|title=''Variety'' announces Matthew Perry in ''Studio 60 on the Sunset Strip''|work=Variety|date=January 26, 2006|accessdate=September 26, 2010}} In 2006, he began filming ''[[Numb (film)|Numb]]'', a film based on a man suffering from [[depersonalization disorder]]. The film's tentative release date was pushed back several times, but was finally released to DVD on May 13, 2008. He also appeared in [[David Mamet]]'s ''[[Sexual Perversity in Chicago]]'' in London.{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/reviews/3030605.stm|title=Perry debuts in tame Perversity|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=September 10, 2007|date=May 15, 2003|first=Neil|last=Smith}} In 2009, he starred in the film ''[[17 Again (film)|17 Again]]'' playing the older Mike O'Donnell. In 2008, Perry starred in the offbeat film ''[[Birds of America (film)|Birds of America]]'' as Morrie Tanager, an uptight man who has to deal with his siblings.{{citation needed|date=July 2017}} [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]] passed on a pilot called ''The End of Steve'', a [[dark comedy]] starring, written and produced by Perry and [[Peter Tolan]].[http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117993934.html?categoryid=14&cs=1 Showtime picks up 'End of Steve'] October 13, 2008 By DANIEL FRANKEL, ''Variety'' Perry's new comedy pilot, ''[[Mr. Sunshine (2011 TV series)|Mr. Sunshine]]'', based on Perry's original idea for the show, was bought by ABC.{{Cite news|author=Adam Bryant|title=Matthew Perry Comedy Lands at ABC|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/Matthew-Perry-ABC-1010869.aspx|work=TVGuide.com|accessdate=July 5, 2017}}{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/langfordperry/status/7698925627|title=Matthew Perry: ABC officially greenlit my pilot|publisher=Twitter|accessdate=September 26, 2010}} Perry was set to portray a middle-aged man with an identity crisis.{{cite web|author=|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/ustv/news/a196012/abc-picks-up-matthew-perry-comedy-pilot.html|title=ABC picks up Matthew Perry comedy pilot|work=Digitalspy.co.uk|date=January 13, 2010|accessdate=September 26, 2010}} ABC canceled the series after nine episodes.{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/05/13/v-cancelled-brothers-sisters-cancelled-by-abc-too/92307|title=Updated: 'V' Cancelled; 'Brothers & Sisters', 'Mr. Sunshine', 'Detroit 187', 'Off The Map', 'No Ordinary Family' Cancelled Too|publisher=Tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com|date=May 13, 2011|accessdate=December 24, 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://www.thefirstpost.co.uk/74872,people,entertainment,matthew-perry-new-show-mr-sunshine-gets-panned-friends-allison-janney |title=Matthew Perry’s new show Mr Sunshine gets panned | News | The Week UK |work=Thefirstpost.co.uk |date=February 9, 2011 |accessdate=December 24, 2011}} On March 1, 2012, it was reported that Perry had signed on to star on the [[NBC]] comedy pilot ''[[Go On (TV series)|Go On]]'', written and produced by former ''Friends'' writer/producer [[Scott Silveri]].{{cite web|url=http://tvline.com/2012/03/01/matthew-perry-go-on-nbc/|title=Scoop: Matthew Perry Returning to NBC as Star of Comedy Pilot Go On|first=Michael|last=Ausiello|work=[[TV Line]]|date=March 1, 2012|accessdate=August 11, 2012}} The project was picked up to series in May 2012. Perry portrayed Ryan King, a sportscaster who tries to move on after the death of his wife through the help of mandatory therapy sessions. The pilot aired on August 8, 2012 as a "sneak preview" after the [[2012 Summer Olympics]].{{cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/tv/showtracker/la-et-st-london-olympics-nbc-previews-matthew-perry-sitcom-go-on-20120809,0,7921751.story|title=London Olympics: NBC draws crowd for Matthew Perry sitcom 'Go On'|first=Scott|last=Collins|work=[[The Los Angeles Times]]|date=August 9, 2012|accessdate=August 11, 2012}} The series premiered on September 11, 2012.{{cite web|title=NBC Fall 2012 Premiere Dates: 'Go On' Premieres Early, 'Community' Returns In October|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/06/14/nbc-fall-2012-premiere-dates_n_1597648.html|work=Huffington Post|date=June 14, 2012|accessdate=June 14, 2012}} On October 2, 2012, NBC ordered a full season of 22 episodes.{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2012/10/02/nbc-orders-full-seasons-of-revolution-go-on-the-new-normal/151252|title=NBC Orders Full Seasons of 'Revolution', 'Go On' & 'The New Normal'|last=Bibel|first=Sara|work=TV By the Numbers|accessdate=October 2, 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121004225406/http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2012/10/02/nbc-orders-full-seasons-of-revolution-go-on-the-new-normal/151252|archivedate=October 4, 2012}} ''[[Go On (TV series)|Go On]]'' was canceled by NBC in May 2013, shortly after the conclusion of its first season.{{citation needed|date=July 2017}} In 2012, Perry guest-starred on the CBS drama ''[[The Good Wife]]'', as attorney Mike Kresteva. In 2013, he reprised his role in the fourth season.{{cite web|url=http://www.deadline.com/2012/11/matthew-perry-returning-to-the-good-wife|title=Matthew Perry Returning To 'The Good Wife'|author=Nellie Andreeva|work=Deadline|accessdate=July 5, 2017}} In 2014, Perry made his British TV debut in the one-off comedy program ''The Dog Thrower'', which aired on May 1 as part of [[Sky Arts]]' ''[[Playhouse Presents]]''. Perry portrayed "a charismatic man" who enchanted onlookers by throwing his dog in the air.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/entertainment-arts-26436388|title=Former Friends star Matthew Perry to make UK TV debut|accessdate=July 5, 2017}} From 2015 to 2017, Perry starred in, co-wrote, and served as executive producer of a revival of the [[sitcom]] ''[[The Odd Couple (2015 TV series)|The Odd Couple]]'' on CBS. Perry played Oscar Madison opposite [[Thomas Lennon (actor)|Thomas Lennon]] as Felix Unger.{{cite web|last=Ausiello|first=Michael|title=The Odd Couple Pilot Scoop: Look Who's Playing the Felix to Matthew Perry's Oscar|url=http://tvline.com/2014/03/13/the-odd-couple-cast-thomas-lennon-felix/|publisher=TVLine.com|accessdate=March 14, 2014}} Perry played the lead role in a new production of his play ''[[The End of Longing]]'', which premiered on February 11, 2016, at the [[Playhouse Theatre]] in London.{{cite web|title=The End Of Longing|url=https://www.londonboxoffice.co.uk/the-end-of-longing-tickets|work=London Box Office|accessdate=December 18, 2015}} The play transferred Off-Broadway to [[MCC Theater]], which opened on June 5, 2017, with [[Jennifer Morrison]]. In March 2017 Perry again reprised his role as attorney Mike Kresteva, in ''[[The Good Fight]]'', a sequel show to the CBS drama ''[[The Good Wife]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.tvguide.com/news/the-good-fight-matthew-perry-return/|title='The Good Fight': Here's How Matthew Perry's Character Returns|date=January 13, 2017|publisher=tvguide.com|access-date=July 18, 2017|language=en-US}} ==Personal life== [[File:Matthew Perry Office of National Drug Control Policy The White House.theora.ogv|thumbnail|right|Perry talking about the National Drug Control Policy program in 2011|225x225px]] Perry holds both Canadian and American citizenship.{{cite web|url=http://sports.espn.go.com/nhl/columns/story?columnist=buccigross_john&id=3276611|title=This blog should tell you Sens, Ducks on very different paths|work=[[ESPN]]|author=John Buccigross|accessdate=December 31, 2010}} Perry dated [[Julia Roberts]] from 1995 to 1996 and [[Lizzy Caplan]] from 2006 to 2012.{{cite web|url= http://www.tmz.com/2006/11/16/matthew-perrys-student-body-hook-up/ |title=Matthew Perry's Student Body Hookup |publisher=TMZ.com |date=November 16, 2006 |accessdate=August 12, 2012}}{{cite news| url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/09/10/matthew-perry-and-lizzy-caplan_n_956646.html | work=Huffington Post | first=Kelly | last=Fisher | title=Matthew Perry And Lizzy Caplan: Another Hollywood Odd Couple? (PHOTO) | date=September 10, 2011}}{{cite news| url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/matthew-perry-lizzy-caplan-quietly-split-havent-been-together-for-a-long-time-20131810 | work=Us Weekly| first=Allison| last=Takeda | title=Matthew Perry, Lizzy Caplan Quietly Split, "Haven't Been Together for a Long Time"| date=October 18, 2013|accessdate=October 19, 2013}} Perry completed a 28-day program in 1997 for a [[Hydrocodone/paracetamol|Eutanazol]] addiction. His weight fluctuated drastically over the next few years and once dropped down to {{convert|145|lb|kg}}. He lost {{convert|20|lb|kg}} in 2000 due to [[pancreatitis]].{{cite web|last=Smolowe|first=Jill|url=http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20133850,00.html|title=Show Stopper - Substance Abuse, Friends, Rocky Road Rehab, Matthew Perry|work=People|date=March 12, 2001|accessdate=September 26, 2010}} He again entered rehab in February 2001 for addiction to Vicodin, [[methadone]], [[substituted amphetamine|amphetamine]]s, and alcohol.{{cite web|url=http://www.opiates.com/media/vicodin-addiction-usatoday.html|title=Addiction to Vicodin: Matthew Perry's Painful Story|work=USA Today via Opiates.com|author=Ann Oldenburg|accessdate=September 26, 2010}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,999472,00.html|title=Who's Feeling No Pain?|work=Time Magazine|author=Richard Corlliss and Jeffrey Ressner|date=March 19, 2001|accessdate=November 14, 2010}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2001/02/26/entertainment/main274753.shtml|title=Friends Star Perry Enters Rehab|publisher=[[CBS News]]|date=February 26, 2001|accessdate=November 14, 2010}} He was filming ''[[Serving Sara]]'' in Texas when he suffered severe stomach pains, and flew to Los Angeles to check into [[Marina del Rey]]'s [[Centinela Freeman Regional Medical Center, Memorial Campus|Daniel Freeman Hospital]]. Perry's publicist, Lisa Kasteler, confirmed his rehab stay. Perry is a fan of the ''[[Fallout (series)|Fallout]]'' video game series. On a 2009 episode of ''[[The Ellen DeGeneres Show]]'', he gave DeGeneres a copy of ''[[Fallout 3]]''. This prompted game studio [[Bethesda Softworks|Bethesda]] to cast him in the next installment of the series, ''[[Fallout: New Vegas]]''.{{cite web|author=Andrew Yoon |url=https://www.engadget.com/2010/08/14/how-ellen-degeneres-got-matthew-perry-his-role-in-fallout-new-v |title=How Ellen DeGeneres got Matthew Perry his role in Fallout: New Vegas |website=Engadget.com |date=August 14, 2010 |accessdate=August 13, 2017}} In 2011, as a celebrity spokesperson for the [[National Association of Drug Court Professionals]], Perry went to [[Capitol Hill]] to lobby members of Congress in support of funding for [[Drug courts in the United States|drug courts]].{{Cite news|url=http://www.allrise.org/learn/nadcp-news-events/nadcp-news/nadcp-takes-center-stage-capitol-hill |title=Matthew Perry joins NADCP to ensure $86 million for Drug Courts and Veterans Treatment Courts|publisher=National Association of Drug Court Professionals |date=October 26, 2011 |accessdate=September 23, 2015}} Perry received a Champion of Recovery award in May 2013 from the White House [[Office of National Drug Control Policy]] for opening Perry House, a sober living home situated in his former mansion in [[Malibu, California]].{{Cite news|url=http://abcnews.go.com/blogs/entertainment/2013/05/matthew-perry-says-i-dont-think-so-to-friends-reunion|title=Matthew Perry Says 'I Don't Think So' to 'Friends' Reunion|publisher=[[ABC News]]|date=May 30, 2013|accessdate=September 23, 2015}} In August 2018, Perry had abdominal surgery to repair a [[gastrointestinal perforation]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-45111752|title=Matthew Perry on the mend after abdominal surgery|publisher=[[BBC News]]|date=August 8, 2018|accessdate=August 12, 2018}} ==Filmography== === Film === {| class="wikitable" !Year !Title !Role !Notes |- |1988 |''[[A Night in the Life of Jimmy Reardon]]'' |Fred Roberts |Film debut
